meanings.definition: The act of declaring something as surplus.
meanings.sent1: The surplusing of old equipment helped make space in the storage room.
meanings.sent2: The surplusing of outdated books allowed for new resources to be purchased.
meanings.sent3: After the surplusing of office supplies, the staff had a surplus of empty shelves.
meanings.sent4: The surplusing of extra chairs from the conference room was like a clearance sale.
meanings.sent5: The surplusing of unused computers was a relief for the IT department.

meanings.definition: The process of disposing of excess inventory.
meanings.sent1: The surplusing of unsold products helped make room for new stock.
meanings.sent2: The company's surplusing of last season's items was necessary to free up space.
meanings.sent3: The surplusing of expired goods was like a spring cleaning for the store.
meanings.sent4: The surplusing of damaged items was a way to make way for fresh inventory.
meanings.sent5: The surplusing of overstocked items was a smart business move.

meanings.definition: The action of transferring an employee to a different position due to redundancy.
meanings.sent1: The surplusing of the employee to a new department was a strategic decision.
meanings.sent2: The surplusing of staff members to other roles helped streamline operations.
meanings.sent3: The surplusing of the worker to a different team led to new opportunities.
meanings.sent4: The surplusing of the team member was like a game of musical chairs.
meanings.sent5: The surplusing of the employee to a different role was a positive change.
